overview: This subject is available only to Bachelor of Music students enrolled concurrently at the Australian National Academy of Music (ANAM).

It consists of large and small ensemble and chamber music performance activities at ANAM, in which students will develop their skills in ensemble and chamber music rehearsal and performance, both under direction and independently.
Projects will include two large ensemble projects and chamber music activities.
ilo: show musical leadership in large ensemble, small ensemble and chamber music contexts;
participate with ability and self-confidence as a team member of a performing group;
demonstrate a capacity to think critically and creatively in matters of style, sonority, balance, ensemble, phrasing, blending and musical gesture;
apply time and people management skills to rehearsal and performance planning;
perform technically and expressively demanding repertoire to concert standard;
engage creatively with the values and principles of ensemble and chamber performance.
generic_skills: communicate constructively in different social situations;
respond openly and imaginatively to new ideas;
work as part of a team to achieve a common goal;
manage competing demands on time, including self-directed project work;
sustain medium and long-term work strategies in pursuit of personal goals.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Weekly preparation of parts, individual and/or sectional practice and active contribution to all rehearsals and coaching sessions as directed
Participation in two ANAM large ensemble performances
30-minute ANAM performance of chamber music repertoire

assessment.hurdle: 100% weekly punctual and full attendance at all rehearsals and performances as directed is expected. Less than 80% attendance will result in a fail.

Students must submit all elements of assessment to be eligible for a pass in this subject. For the purposes of meeting this hurdle requirement, each submitted assessment must be complete and constitute a genuine attempt to address the requirements of the task. Submitting only part of an assessment (e.g. only the title page) or an assessment on an irrelevant topic will not meet this hurdle requirement.
